Cryptography primitives¶

pyoauth.crypto.hash¶

module:pyoauth.crypto.hash
synopsis:Convenient hashing functions.

SHA-1 digests¶

pyoauth.crypto.hash.sha1_digest(*inputs)[source]¶

Calculates a SHA-1 digest of a variable number of inputs.

Parameters:inputs – A variable number of inputs for which the digest will be calculated.
Returns:A byte string containing the SHA-1 message digest.
pyoauth.crypto.hash.sha1_hex_digest(*inputs)[source]¶

Calculates hexadecimal representation of the SHA-1 digest of a variable number of inputs.

Parameters:inputs – A variable number of inputs for which the digest will be calculated.
Returns:Hexadecimal representation of the SHA-1 digest.
pyoauth.crypto.hash.sha1_base64_digest(value)[source]¶

Calculates Base-64-encoded SHA-1 digest of a variable number of inputs.

Parameters:inputs – A variable number of inputs for which the digest will be calculated.
Returns:Base-64-encoded SHA-1 digest.

MD5 digests¶

pyoauth.crypto.hash.md5_digest(*inputs)[source]¶

Calculates a MD5 digest of a variable number of inputs.

Parameters:inputs – A variable number of inputs for which the digest will be calculated.
Returns:A byte string containing the MD5 message digest.
pyoauth.crypto.hash.md5_hex_digest(*inputs)[source]¶

Calculates hexadecimal representation of the MD5 digest of a variable number of inputs.

Parameters:inputs – A variable number of inputs for which the digest will be calculated.
Returns:Hexadecimal representation of the MD5 digest.

HMAC-SHA-1 digests¶

pyoauth.crypto.hash.hmac_sha1_digest(key, data)[source]¶

Calculates a HMAC SHA-1 digest.

Parameters:
  • key – The key for the digest.
  • data – The data for which the digest will be calculted.
Returns:

HMAC SHA-1 Digest.
pyoauth.crypto.hash.hmac_sha1_base64_digest(key, data)[source]¶

Calculates a base64-encoded HMAC SHA-1 signature.

Parameters:
  • key – The key for the signature.
  • data – The data to be signed.
Returns:

Base64-encoded HMAC SHA-1 signature.

pyoauth.crypto.primes¶

module:pyoauth.crypto.primes
synopsis:Cryptographic prime number routines.

Verification¶

pyoauth.crypto.primes.is_prime(n, iterations=5)[source]¶

Determines whether a number is prime.

Parameters:
  • n – Number
  • iterations – Number of iterations.
Returns:

True if prime; False otherwise.

Random¶

pyoauth.crypto.primes.generate_random_prime(bits)[source]¶

Generates a random prime number.

Parameters:bits – Number of bits.
Returns:Prime number long value.
pyoauth.crypto.primes.generate_random_safe_prime(bits)[source]¶

Unused at the moment.

Generates a random prime number.

Parameters:bits – Number of bits.
Returns:Prime number long value.

pyoauth.crypto.random¶

module:pyoauth.crypto.random
synopsis:Random number and string generation utilities.

Bytes and byte arrays¶

pyoauth.crypto.random.generate_random_bytes(count)[source]¶

Generates a random byte string with count bytes.

Parameters:count – Number of bytes.
Returns:Random byte string.
pyoauth.crypto.random.generate_random_bytearray(count)[source]¶

Generates a random byte array.

Parameters:count – The number of bytes.
Returns:A random byte array.

Numbers¶

pyoauth.crypto.random.generate_random_long(low, high)[source]¶

Generates a random long integer.

Parameters:
  • low – Low
  • high – High
Returns:

Random long integer value.

Strings¶

pyoauth.crypto.random.generate_random_uint_string(bit_strength=64, base=10)[source]¶

Generates a random ASCII-encoded unsigned integral number in decimal or hexadecimal representation.

Parameters:
  • bit_strength – Bit strength.
  • base –
    One of:
    1. 10 (default)
    2. 16
    3. 64
Returns:

A string representation of a randomly-generated ASCII-encoded hexadecimal/decimal-representation unsigned integral number based on the bit strength specified.
pyoauth.crypto.random.generate_random_hex_string(length=8)[source]¶

Generates a random ASCII-encoded hexadecimal string of an even length.

Parameters:length – Length of the string to be returned. Default 32. The length MUST be a positive even number.
Returns:A string representation of a randomly-generated hexadecimal string.

pyoauth.crypto.codec¶

module:pyoauth.crypto.codec
synopsis:Codecs to encode and decode keys and certificates in various formats.

PEM key decoders¶

pyoauth.crypto.codec.public_key_pem_decode(pem_key)[source]¶

Decodes a PEM-encoded public key/X.509 certificate string into internal representation.

Parameters:pem_key – The PEM-encoded key. Must be one of: 1. RSA public key. 2. X.509 certificate.
Returns:A dictionary of key information.
pyoauth.crypto.codec.private_key_pem_decode(pem_key)[source]¶

Decodes a PEM-encoded private key string into internal representation.

Parameters:pem_key – The PEM-encoded RSA private key.
Returns:A dictionary of key information.

pyoauth.crypto.codec.pem¶

module:pyoauth.crypto.codec.pem
synopsis:PEM/DER conversion utilities.

PEM/DER codec¶

pyoauth.crypto.codec.pem.pem_to_der(pem_cert_string, pem_header, pem_footer)[source]¶

Extracts the DER as a byte sequence out of an ASCII PEM formatted certificate or key.

Taken from the Python SSL module.

Parameters:
  • pem_cert_string – The PEM certificate or key string.
  • pem_header – The PEM header to find.
  • pem_footer – The PEM footer to find.
pyoauth.crypto.codec.pem.der_to_pem(der_cert_bytes, pem_header, pem_footer)[source]¶

Takes a certificate in binary DER format and returns the PEM version of it as a string.

Taken from the Python SSL module.

Parameters:
  • der_cert_bytes – A byte string of the DER.
  • pem_header – The PEM header to use.
  • pem_footer – The PEM footer to use.

Miscellaneous¶

pyoauth.crypto.codec.pem.cert_time_to_seconds(cert_time)[source]¶

Takes a date-time string in standard ASN1_print form (“MON DAY 24HOUR:MINUTE:SEC YEAR TIMEZONE”) and return a Python time value in seconds past the epoch.

Parameters:cert_time – Time value in the certificate.
Returns:Python time value.

pyoauth.crypto.rsa¶

module:pyoauth.crypto.rsa
synopsis:Factory functions for RSA public and private keys.

Encoded key parsing¶

pyoauth.crypto.rsa.parse_private_key(encoded_key, encoding='PEM')[source]¶
pyoauth.crypto.rsa.parse_public_key(encoded_key, encoding='PEM')[source]¶

pyoauth.crypto.rsa.keys¶

pyoauth.crypto.rsa.pycrypto¶

module:pyoauth.crypto.rsa.PyCrypto
synopsis:PyCrypto RSA implementation wrapper.
class pyoauth.crypto.rsa.pycrypto.PrivateKey(key_info, encoded_key, encoding)[source]¶

Represents a RSA private key.

Parameters:
  • encoded_key – The encoded key string.
  • encoding – The encoding method of the key. Default PEM.
class pyoauth.crypto.rsa.pycrypto.PublicKey(key_info, encoded_key, encoding)[source]¶

Represents a RSA public key.

Parameters:
  • encoded_key – The encoded key string.
  • encoding – The encoding method of the key. Default PEM.
